Html:
Hey everyone, anyone else having an issue when trying to use a longer MSI product code in an install rule etc - The new version of Java 8 has a longer code and I can't enter the last digit:

Eg Java 8x64 u99
26a24ae4-039d-4ca4-87b4-2f86418099f0

Latest Java 8x64 u101
26a24ae4-039d-4ca4-87b4-2f864180101f0

This is going to cause me some issues as I have created a package to "install" not update Java but check for existing versions and so I need to list all available versions otherwise I'm going to get duplicate installs.

That has to be a bug on Oracles part.

That isn't a valid GUID as the length is fixed, you can't simply throw an extra digit on the end of it.

Indeed - I just checked their Release notes and nothing yet about it. We use the patchmypc catalog and they have just released Java 8 u101 but they have thankfully amended the GUID so its correct "26a24ae4-039d-4ca4-87b4-2f86418101f0" and "26a24ae4-039d-4ca4-87b4-2f88618101f0"

Hopefully we won't have many machines that have sourced Java directly from Oracle as that would cause some issues with other custom updates we have.
